definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: I go to one of the larger chains.
sentences.chinese: 我通常去大型的連鎖商店。

sentences.english: Dating sites have for the most part always had either a squalid or a chain-store ambience.
sentences.chinese: 相親網站多半有要麼醜惡要麼像連鎖商店一樣的格調。

sentences.english: He returned to China and opened his own chain of stores.
sentences.chinese: 他返回中國且建立了自己的連鎖商店。

sentences.english: The rise of the chain store has inhibited the development of single proprietorships and partnerships.
sentences.chinese: 連鎖商店的興起阻礙了個體企業和合夥企業的發展。

sentences.english: There are also some chain stores that have been founded in recent years that deal specifically in babies clothing.
sentences.chinese: 近幾年，還出現了專營兒童服裝的連鎖商店。
